-Knowledge of MS Office and Adobe software
-Positive, thorough, and proactive communication a must as there will be constant interaction with Clients, architects, and subcontractors

The position entails acting as an office resource, providing project support by performing code analyses, writing/editing specifications, and performing QA/QC reviews of documents at various stages of development. The candidate would oversee the firm's code library and ensure all documentation is up-to-date.
 
The following is required of the candidate:
 
•	Licensure in New York State is REQUIRED 
•	Bachelor or Master of Architecture degree (professional degree only) 
•	15+ years of experience 
•	Should be self-motivated and be able to work independently
•	Familiarity with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
•	Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
•	Excellent collaborator
 
Preferred project experience includes: K-12 schools, higher-ed and design of large scale public projects (transit stations and convention centers). Experience and interest in sustainable design / documentation / LEED strongly encouraged, with applicable certifications preferred. Email resumes and examples of work to positions@ddp-ny.com
 
di Domenico + Partners, LLP is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Project Architect
Description:
Scott Henson Architect is an award winning Architecture firm specializing in the preservation and restoration of historic buildings with a diverse portfolio of work in and around New York City. We have extensive experience in the assessment, design and detailing of building exteriors including the preparation of comprehensive conditions reports, construction documents and specifications, full and phased construction cost estimates, city agency filing, and contract procurement and administration.

We work closely with our clients to investigate and assess building conditions, develop strategic and economically responsible recommendations for their repair, and implement the design through construction. We believe that architecture is a collaborative effort and are committed to working with our clients to develop a well-tailored solution based on their unique project conditions and far-reaching objectives. To achieve this, we seek to always maintain an open and transparent line of communication to ensure that projects are delivered in a timely and efficient manner.

Job Description:

We are seeking a Project Architect with at least 2 years of experience who has an aptitude for problem solving and the desire for a leadership role in a dynamic, collaborative work environment. Primary responsibilities include daily management, coordination and successful completion of restoration and preservation projects to meet time and cost objectives.  The candidate must be well versed in all facets of building exterior envelope, weatherproofing, masonry repair, historic preservation, landmarks and roofing projects.

To be considered, the preferred candidate should have demonstrated abilities to:

Identify new work opportunities and pursue potential projects with new or current clients.
Participate in proposal development and business development activities.
Develop design concepts through construction documents.
Conduct contractor bid solicitations and reviews.
Perform contract administration and construction management services.
Create and maintain project schedules, administer change orders, review payment applications and oversee completion of project close-out.
Develop and actively monitor project budgets to ensure profitability, and maintain client relationships.
Work efficiently on multiple projects, both independently and with team members.
Demonstrate excellent written and verbal communication skills with team members, consultants and clients.
Demonstrate strong interpersonal communication, organization and leadership skills, as well as ability to train others and monitor their work for quality and completeness.
Requirements:

The preferred candidate will be a Registered Architect or on track to complete their registration. LEED Accreditation will be beneficial.
Bachelors or Masters Degree in Architecture required, Masters Degree in Preservation preferred.
Minimum of 2 years' experience in designing and administering Restoration and Preservation projects.
Experience with New York City Building Codes and Zoning Regulations.
Experience coordinating NYC Department of Buildings and Landmark Preservation Commission filings.
Working knowledge of AutoCAD, Adobe Suite programs, Revit, Rhino and rendering programs.
Benefits and Compensation:

SHA offers a competitive compensation and benefits package, including 401(k) retirement plan with company match and health coverage.
Opportunities for professional growth and advancement.
Continuing educational opportunities.
We hire carefully for the long term. Compensation commensurate with skills, background and experience.
 
To Apply:

Please email a resume, cover letter and selected work samples (under 8mb); reference "Project Architect" in the subject line. Work samples should emphasize built projects, examples of construction documents and detailing.

Applicants selected for an interview will be asked to bring their full portfolios and references.
Compensation: Compensation commensurate with skills, background and experience.

Title: Project Architect
Description:
Joseph Vance Architects is a small but growing residential architecture firm based in Williamsburg just off McCarren Park. In our 27 years of business we have established ourselves as one of the premier firms specializing in brownstone and townhouse renovations, additions, ground-up construction, lofts and apartments. We are currently seeking a mid level Project Architect/Manager to join our ranks.

As a member of our team you will manage your own projects under the direction of the principal, and with the support of the office as needed to help meet deadlines. The format of our firm is such that everyone is expected to run his/her own jobs - generating designs, presentations and drawings, researching codes, managing schedules, and coordinating with clients, contractors, expeditors, city agencies, vendors, consultants, etc. throughout the entire process of the project from initial client meetings to punch-list closeout. The nature of our business requires immense organization, efficiency, and commitment, but we also maintain a very stable work/life balance. 

Ideally you have experience in residential architecture in NYC, some knowledge of NYC DOB and LPC, have worked with 3D modeling/BIM software (Archicad a plus) and the adobe creative suite. We also expect you to have a great design sensibility and critical thinking skills, along with 4-8 years of professional experience.

If this sounds like you, then please submit a pdf of your cover letter, resume, and work sample. This is a full time salaried position with medical coverage (no part-time or freelance work). We look forward to hearing from you and appreciate your interest in our firm!

Title: ESTIMATOR
Description:
About AAL: Based in the Bronx, AAL Construction Services provides a full-scope of civil site work services including but not limited to land clearing and grading, demolition and excavation, shoreline restoration and development, and waste hauling and removal. 

Position: AAL is looking to engage an experienced Estimator to produce construction estimates for public and private contracts in New York and New Jersey. The Estimator will be hired on a project-basis, with a minimum of ten projects per month totaling approximately $5 million. 

Responsibilities:
Identify labor, material, and time requirements by studying proposals, blueprints, specifications, and related documents.
Attend walk-throughs to check field conditions & prepare estimates
Manage multiple simultaneous estimating projects on a timely manner
Identify potential errors or omissions on plans and bid documents, resolve discrepancies by collecting and analyzing information.
Present prepared estimate by assembling and displaying numerical and descriptive information

Qualifications: 
Strong knowledge of prevailing wages, project labor agreements, and union labor rates 
Proven experience as a construction estimator, with emphasis on civil site work
Ability to work collaboratively with others in performing scope, design development, bid and change order cost estimating duties
Strong understanding of NYC construction processes, experience working with City and State agencies
Ability to perform detailed work under time-sensitive deadlines 
Education in civil engineering or architecture or significant years of experience in civil site construction estimating
Great attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Well-organized and reliable

Interested candidates should send a cover letter and resume to Ana Lavdas, President at ana@aalconstructionservices.com

Title: Facade / Building Envelope Project Architect or Engineer
Description:
New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure is currently seeking a project architect or engineer with 5 to 10 years of restoration experience.  

SUPERSTRUCTURES works on an array of challenging projects on many of New York's most prominent buildings. We've won frequent awards, as well as the loyalty of some of the premier clients in the region -- public, corporate and residential.  Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure - facades, roofs, windows, and plazas - and the full complement of materials, from landmark terra cotta to high performance curtain walls. We take pride in being an industry leader in such practice areas as Local Law 11 inspections and repairs. 

We work in teams. Teams are assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a "small office experience" coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state of the art non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques.  

Employees typically participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see the designs you draw executed in the field, and you'll take on greater responsibility and client exposure as soon as you are ready.  

Frequent lunchtime seminars by industry experts, including our own in-house personnel, keep us current on developments in the profession (with the additional benefit of a free lunch).  

SUPERSTRUCTURES offers top-level compensation for top-level people, and the advancement potential of a thriving company.  

We are committed to a work / life balance, and to a work week of 40 hours.  When, on occasion, more than 40 hours are required, our employees are compensated for every additional hour worked. 
Our benefits include paid holidays, vacation and sick days, health insurance for employee and family, 401(k) with automatic employer contribution, a continuing education allowance, and free NYC Transit MetroCards.  

Our light-filled office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and drop dead views in three directions - not a bad place to spend the workday. 

Our Tribeca location is one of New York City's most convenient and vibrant, easily accessible via public transportation. The A, C, and E subway lines stop right in the building. The N, R, #1, and #6 lines are each just a few blocks away. 

SUPERSTRUCTURES welcomes applications in reply to this posting. Please include a cover letter with salary requirements, your resume, and a few pages of attachments that display your capabilities (maximum of 10MB please).  

Note: Our thanks in advance to those submitting applications; only those candidates under consideration will be contacted.   

For additional information, visit our website at

Title: Revit Specialist for High-End Glass Wall Company
Description:
Hi! Thanks for your interest, please check out the details below, and if it seems like the right position for you, please reach out with any questions:

JOB DESCRIPTION 
Wing Partners is looking for an architectural Revit drafter to join our company. Currently we do all of our shop drawings in 2D with AutoCAD, and we need someone to help us translate those to Revit. You'll be working alongside experienced project managers who manage multi-million dollar projects, building workplaces for fortune 500 companies. We specialize in glass wall systems for office interiors. (Check out our website for photos www.wingpartners.com). Please note that this is not a design role, but your Revit experience should specifically be in architecture or interior design. 

You will be consulting with our project managers on the details of each project's design, to convert AutoCAD drawings to Revit. You'll also be consulting with the factory to ensure that our Revit process is correct according to the system they developed.

RESPONSIBILITIES 
* Review construction documents
* Develop shop drawings in Revit based on 2D AutoCAD drawings, including plans, elevations, sections, and details
* Assist project managers with change orders, as-built drawings, and other related project tasks
* There may be an opportunity to assist with a broader scope of project management if that appeals to you

REQUIREMENTS
* Proficiency in Revit. Knowledge of AutoCAD
* Be able to read and understand construction documents
* Strong communication skills in English
* Self-driven, detail oriented, well organized. 
* Located in the NYC metro area

COMPENSATION & TIME 
40 hours per week, with a salary paid bi-weekly. Office hours are 9am-6pm. Health benefits are available after a waiting period of 60 days. Salary will be depending on experience, approximately $45000/year to start.

ABOUT US
Wing Partners is a full-service distributor of modern, high-end customized glass wall systems. We work closely with architects and interior designers to help them achieve their visions for the workplaces of clients such as IBM, Under Armour, AMC, Heineken, Coach, Nike, and many more. At Wing Partners, we're a small tight-knit group who works hard and likes to have fun. Our showroom is in Chelsea, New York City.

CONTACT
Check out our website at WingPartners.com. To apply, please email Joe with your resume/cv, a cover letter, and some Revit work samples using the craigslist link. Thanks!

Title: Project Manager for Luxury Home Technology A/V Company
Description:
***ATTENTION PROJECT MANAGERS IN RESIDENTIAL CONSTRUCTION OR RELATED FIELD (COMMERCIAL SIGNAGE, SHADES, EXHIBITION DESIGN, EVENT/TRADESHOW DESIGN) LOOKING FOR A NEW CHALLENGE***

Do you have 3-5 years of experience managing projects in the residential building/construction industry or related field? Do you love technology? Are you looking for a place to grow your career in the exciting home automation industry?

Osbee Industries, Inc. is a smart home integration company serving highly affluent residential clients in the New York/Westchester area. We continue to grow and are looking for smart, curious, versatile problem solvers to join our team.

As a Project Manager, you will be involved in multiple jobs every step of the way, from initial client meetings to the final walkthrough. We work with some of the most elite architecture and interior design firms in the country. Every project we take on is custom-designed and engineered specifically for the needs of each client, so you will always be learning new things and be looked to for creative solutions -- you will never be bored.

The experience and skills that make you the perfect person for the job:

- Experience or interest in residential or commercial smart home integration, A/V, and/or electronic control systems
- At least 3 years hands-on PM skills in managing multiple projects from start to finish
- Excellent communication skills and flawless English writing, grammar, and speaking abilities
- Highly organized with a natural and exceptional ability to work with many different teams and solve problems in a collaborative way
- Exceptional proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, and Outlook. Visio and AutoCAD proficiency a plus.
- Knowledge of low-voltage, lighting, and/or control systems (such as Crestron or Savant) a major plus

What you'll do on the job:

- Meet with clients, including architects, interior designers, builders, owner's representatives, and homeowners on a regular basis at all phases of the project
- Manage project workflow and schedules on multiple jobs at various stages of completion
- Work closely with our engineering/estimating, billing, and customer service teams to prepare estimates for proposals, and purchase orders, change orders/billing for approved projects
- Coordinate with our technicians, installers, IT, inventory, and support staff to ensure deadlines are being planned for and met
- Review AutoCAD blueprints, plans, and notes from architects, contractors, and sub-contractors
- Develop low-voltage plans, RCPs, shade pocket plans, home theater elevations, etc. using Visio or AutoCAD with assistance from our AutoCAD artist
- Work closely with Osbee technicians/Installers as well as multiple contractors and sub-contractors to answer questions and solve problems as they arise
- Make regular site visits to our clients in New York City, Westchester NY, Fairfield CT, and occasionally other locations
- Attend webinars, Osbee seminars, and industry trainings to stay on the cutting edge of what we do

Other details about this position:

- PM experience specifically in the A/V Home Integration industry is desired but not necessary - we will teach you what you need to know
- This is NOT an IT or Web PM job. You must have some experience in the construction industry or other related sectors, such as signage, display, or exhibition.
- You must be able to lift up to 25 pounds
- A US driver's license with a clean driving record is required
- You must be able to work in the US without sponsorship now or in the future

About Osbee:

Osbee is the leading residential home integrator on the East Coast. Established 20 years ago, we pride ourselves on having a team of professionals that is the best in the industry. We're a Platinum Elite Crestron dealer, have won numerous awards, and we get to play with all the coolest new toys before anyone else.

Benefits:

Title: Mechanical Design Engineer

Mini-Circuits designs, manufactures and distributes integrated circuits, modules, and sub-systems for high performance radio frequency (RF) and microwave applications. Our products are also used in detection, measurement and imaging applications, including military communication, guidance and electronic countermeasure systems, commercial, scientific, military land, sea and aircraft; automotive systems, medical systems, and industrial test equipment. •	Ability to read, write and orally communicate proficiently in English.
•	Solid experience using Solidworks and AutoCAD as tools for creating designs and layouts, and for creating shop drawings for the manufacture of mechanical parts.
•	Solid experience designing parts from metal / sheet metal for manufacture.
•	Knowledge of basic manufacturing and machine shop practices.
•	Ability to independently manage multiple concurrent projects from start to finish, i.e. managing project schedules and the work of members from other departments supporting the project.
•	Excellent hands-on mechanical aptitude.
•	Must have a commitment to quality and customer service.
•	Knowledge of Microsoft Office programs (Word, Excel, etc.)
•	Must be highly organized and a strong team player.
•	Willingness to work beyond standard work hours in order to meet or beat project deadlines.
•	Able to work under pressure with purpose and a sense of urgency, especially when there are competing deadlines.
•	Ability to lift up to 30 lbs.
•	Ability to stand, bend & walk for long periods of time when required. 


Local candidates highly preferred and will be given first priority (no relocation assistance offered).

Title: Revit Expert needed at High-End Glass Wall Company
Description:
Hi! Thanks for your interest, please check out the details below, and if it seems like the right position for you, please reach out with any questions:

JOB DESCRIPTION 
Wing Partners is looking for an experienced architectural Revit drafter to join our company. Currently we do all of our shop drawings in 2D with AutoCAD, and we need someone to help us translate those to Revit. You'll be working alongside experienced project managers who manage multi-million dollar projects, building workplaces for fortune 500 companies. We specialize in glass wall systems for office interiors. (Check out our website for photos www.wingpartners.com). Please note that this is not a design role, but your Revit experience should specifically be in architecture or interior design. 

**It's not a requirement, but ideally, we are looking for a candidate who can speak Italian, since our factory is based in Italy. The Revit families for our wall system have been developed in Italy, so this will make communication much easier during the learning period.

You will be consulting with our project managers on the details of each project's design, to convert AutoCAD drawings to Revit. You'll also be consulting with the factory to ensure that our Revit process is correct and that the results can be inserted into their production system.

RESPONSIBILITIES 
* Review construction documents
* Develop shop drawings in Revit based on 2D AutoCAD drawings
* Help create a Revit process for our company to produce Revit drawings which:
     * Can go directly to the production line in the factory
     * Are in a presentable format to send to architecture firms
   
REQUIREMENTS
* Proficiency in both Revit and AutoCAD
* Be able to read and understand construction documents
* Strong communication skills, in English, and ideally in Italian as well.
* Self-driven, detail oriented, well organized.  
* Located in the NYC metro area
 
COMPENSATION & TIME 
40 hours per week, with a salary paid bi-weekly. Office hours are 9am-6pm. Health benefits are available after a waiting period of 60 days. Salary will be depending on experience, approximately $45000/year.

ABOUT US
Wing Partners is a full-service distributor of modern, high-end customized glass wall systems. We work closely with architects and interior designers to help them achieve their visions for the workplaces of clients such as IBM, Under Armour, AMC, Heineken, Coach, Nike, and many more. At Wing Partners, we're a small tight-knit group who works hard and likes to have fun. Our showroom is in Chelsea, New York City.

CONTACT
Check out our website at WingPartners.com. To apply, please email Joe with your resume/cv, a cover letter, and some Revit work samples using the craigslist link. Thanks!

A comprehensive understanding of architectural and mechanical plans as well as strong written and verbal communication skills is required.

- Assigning projects to Project Completion Supervisors and Directors

- Involvement with Project Department Manager to assist in the development of the department

- Perform walkthroughs and DOB inspections for construction completion and PA permits (as required)
- Coordinate inspection staff and review walkthrough reports
- Basic knowledge of construction means and method and building codes/inspections
- Involvement with partners to assist in the development of the department by attending monthly leadership meetings
- Reports and updates related to their staff and department by presenting monthly reports to the partners and attending weekly individual meetings with their department head
- Able to perform all tasks and responsibilities of the staff they supervise

Qualifications:
- Must have a 4-year degree in either Architecture or Engineering
- Minimum of seven (7) years of relevant experience in the expediting/consulting industry
- Hold Department of Buildings Class 2 ID
- Strong interpersonal, communicative, and writing skills
- Interested in networking and developing in New York's architecture scene


We're seeking someone with the desire and drive to become a long-term, indispensable member of our team. Compensation range is $80-100k, based on experience and education.

Hours are 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM, Monday through Friday. Our firm offers full medical and dental benefits, long-term disability, and paid vacation.

Please submit your resume, cover letter, and salary requirements.

Title: FREE Career Fair/Job Fair ~ 100's of Jobs ~ 25+ Employers
Facade / Building Envelope Project Architect or Engineer
Description:
New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure is currently seeking a project architect or engineer with 5 to 10 years of restoration experience.  

SUPERSTRUCTURES works on an array of challenging projects on many of New York's most prominent buildings. We've won frequent awards, as well as the loyalty of some of the premier clients in the region -- public, corporate and residential.  Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure - facades, roofs, windows, and plazas - and the full complement of materials, from landmark terra cotta to high performance curtain walls. We take pride in being an industry leader in such practice areas as Local Law 11 inspections and repairs. 

We work in teams. Teams are assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a "small office experience" coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state of the art non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques.  

Employees typically participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see the designs you draw executed in the field, and you'll take on greater responsibility and client exposure as soon as you are ready.  

Frequent lunchtime seminars by industry experts, including our own in-house personnel, keep us current on developments in the profession (with the additional benefit of a free lunch).  

SUPERSTRUCTURES offers top-level compensation for top-level people, and the advancement potential of a thriving company.  

We are committed to a work / life balance, and to a work week of 40 hours.  When, on occasion, more than 40 hours are required, our employees are compensated for every additional hour worked. 
Our benefits include paid holidays, vacation and sick days, health insurance for employee and family, 401(k) with automatic employer contribution, a continuing education allowance, and free NYC Transit MetroCards.  

Our light-filled office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and drop dead views in three directions - not a bad place to spend the workday. 

Our Tribeca location is one of New York City's most convenient and vibrant, easily accessible via public transportation. The A, C, and E subway lines stop right in the building. The N, R, #1, and #6 lines are each just a few blocks away. 

SUPERSTRUCTURES welcomes applications in reply to this posting. Please include a cover letter with salary requirements, your resume, and a few pages of attachments that display your capabilities (maximum of 10MB please).  

Note: Our thanks in advance to those submitting applications; only those candidates under consideration will be contacted.   

For additional information, visit our website at

Title: Construction Superintendent
Description:
Job Description:

The responsibilities and duties of this position described here are representative of those an employee must perform. This is not a comprehensive list and other duties may be assigned. 

Prior experience with CORE AND SHELL/BASE BUILDING construction projects and RETAIL experience greatly preferred for this position. 

Employees will contribute to and consistently apply our policies and procedures by effectively working with all company personnel without the regard to race, religion, age, national origin, gender, physical or mental disability. 

1.	Develop project construction schedule detailing the timing of material delivery, subcontractor work schedules and overall project plans. Advise Project Manager of circumstances and issues that will have a significant impact on the project schedule. 
2.	Prepare and maintain reports in accordance with company policies and procedures that accurately describe project status. Document issues and problems that have developed along with identification of the person(s) responsible for their resolution. 
3.	Verify accuracy of drawing plan measurements of floors, walls, ceilings, etc. Identify discrepancies and take corrective action with Estimating or Project Manager. 
4.	Schedule the routing and delivery of materials and take appropriate precautions to prevent job-site theft. Ensure schedule takes into account current tenant work schedules and building access/elevator usage for oversized materials. 
5.	Co-chair weekly project construction meetings with subcontractors, architects, engineers, other vendors and owner to discuss project status. Document issues that impact the project schedule or will impact project budget and assign resolution to appropriate individuals in attendance. 
6.	Recommend overtime work requests to Project Manager and obtain appropriate security clearances for approved overtime. 
7.	Continually enforce safety policies and procedures. Attend relevant courses on safety programs and stay up to date on latest trends. 
8.	Make active attempts to resolve labor disputes and personnel problems. Take unresolved issues to Project Manager when needed. 
9.	Establish effective working relationships with client, architects, building manager, building engineer and others. Actively enforce all building regulations regarding noise, use of elevators, security, etc. 
10.	Maintain adequate and competent subcontractor labor crews as approved to complete timely and quality work. Schedule and coordinate work crews consistent with project demands and schedule. Supervise work of crews to ensure work is completed as contracted with a minimal punch list. Meet daily with subcontractors to ensure daily schedules and task lists are understood. 
11.	Take necessary steps to maintain general conditions costs including trash dumpster use, security guards and general laborers at the budgeted amounts. 
12.	Review invoices from subcontractors and vendors and recommend approval or modification to Project Manager. 
13.	Document all field changes and "as-built conditions" to Project Manager on a weekly basis. 
14.	Obtain client and or architect signature on final punch list completion certificate. 
15.	Assist Project Manager and/or Estimators by reviewing bid documents and estimates from a logistics, scope of items and general field perspective. 

Position Requirements; Qualifications 

To perform this job successfully, an individual should meet the following minimum requirements and qualifications. 

Bachelor's degree in Construction Science or equivalent work experience is a plus. 
5+ years of field experience in commercial interiors projects. Experience should include supervisory responsibility as a General Foreman or Field Engineer. Well developed communications, interpersonal, organizational and team work skills are required. 


We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

EEA Culture

EEA is a mid-size firm with enough capability, experience and resource to take on the largest of development projects. At the same time, our company is organized in smaller studios which provide for numerous client and employee benefits. As an example of an outward benefit, our studio model ensures that repeat clients interact with consistent managerial and engineering staff that is familiar with client operational models, expectations, norms, etc. Inwardly, studios and the smaller project teams within them, allow our employees to form tight-knit and collegial professional relationships, allow for seamless work sharing and more.

Beyond a culture which rewards excellence, "sets the bar high", and strives to consistently and relentlessly exceed expectations, our internal culture is centered around five additional tenets:

Title: Project Architect

Joseph Vance Architects is a small but growing residential architecture firm based in Williamsburg just off McCarren Park. Title: Engineering Field Technician
Description:
We are a small consulting engineering firm specializing in building evaluation and repair. Our projects range from masonry townhouse renovations to registered Historic Landmark churches, masonry warehouses, and civil structures. Most of our projects involve on-site evaluation of structures using nondestructive and in-place test methods, structural analysis, and design of stabilization schemes. We are looking for an engineering technician to help project engineers in the office and in the field. 

Duties: 
-- Help with field evaluation of structures, including testing, photography, and removal of test specimens. Use of power tools and physical ability to work on construction sites is necessary. 
-- Employees must have the capability to work in attics and crawlspaces, work off scaffolds, lifts or swing stage; previous scaffold safety training is a plus.
-- Enter results of tests into computer databases and assemble test reports. 
-- Assist with drafting project details using AutoCAD.
-- Employees must have the capability to travel occasionally to projects throughout the U.S. 

Qualifications:
Prospective employees must be organized, detail-oriented, have good math skills, basic AutoCAD experience, a good technical mind, be able to work without close supervision, and be willing to learn about new technology. Applicants must be able to lift 50+ pounds, have a valid driver's license with a clean driving record, and maintain a professional appearance. 

Salary and Benefits:
We offer competitive salaries, excellent benefits, and opportunities to work on challenging, high-profile projects. Salary will be commensurate with experience and ability.

Work Schedule:
We have some flexibility with scheduling and are willing to work with employees if less than full-time employment is desired. Occasional out-of-town travel and work on weekends is required. 

To apply, please send a short email about yourself with resume attached as PDF with "Engineering Field Technician" in the subject line.

Atkinson Noland & Associates
See www.ana-usa.com for more information about our company.

Title: Consulting/Contract Role for Energy Auditors and Energy Engineers
Description:
A small boutique energy services company is looking to bring on multiple energy consultants to support their growing list of commercial clients.  As a consultant, you'll have the flexibility to accept or deny any potential work available, perform analyses, technical work, and documentation remotely at a time that is convenient for you.  Some onsite work may be needed, however it can be scheduled to accommodate your availability (e.g., evening or weekend is acceptable if you have a day job).   As a consultant, you'll be expected to use your own computer and software to perform any work. 

Your primary responsibilities will be to participate in energy audits, retro-commissioning studies, and other energy-efficiency and built environment related projects for various clients. You will be supported by the project manager to perform investigations and functional testing of heating, ventilation, and air conditioning (HVAC) equipment; energy management, and control systems, lighting, power, and other energy-related systems. You will identify and recommend energy conservation measures that reduce energy consumption and demand, and will estimate energy savings and costs to perform those actions and document your work in a report.

Primary Responsibilities:
- Conduct onsite facility audits.
- Perform field inspections and functional performance tests.
- Review operating modes, sequence of operations, and maintenance of equipment.- 
- Act as technical lead to support energy audits and retro-commissioning activities
- Develop facility energy conservation measures and efficiency improvements.
- Develop energy savings estimations through energy modeling and engineering calculations.
- Maintain detailed and accurate project records including data, documentation, and reports.
- Produce technically correct finished work
- Analyze energy and utilities data

Minimum Qualifications:
- Bachelors Degree in a technical field such as Engineering, Building Science, Construction, Energy Analysis, Environmental Studies
- Two years experience performing energy audits or retro-commissioning studies

Preferred Qualifications:
- Four years experience performing energy audits or retro-commissioning studies
- Holds either Certified Energy Manager, Certified Energy Auditor, or Existing Building Commissioning Professional certifications from Association of Energy Engineers
- Experience working in commercial office buildings and understands their unique operating characteristics, typical energy conservation measures with favorable financial metrics, and understands dynamics between tenants and owners/operators.


 To be considered, please submit your resume.

Title: Facade / Building Envelope Project Architect or Engineer
Description:
New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure is currently seeking a project architect or engineer with 5 to 10 years of restoration experience.  

SUPERSTRUCTURES works on an array of challenging projects on many of New York's most prominent buildings. We've won frequent awards, as well as the loyalty of some of the premier clients in the region -- public, corporate and residential.  Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure - facades, roofs, windows, and plazas - and the full complement of materials, from landmark terra cotta to high performance curtain walls. We take pride in being an industry leader in such practice areas as Local Law 11 inspections and repairs. 

We work in teams. Teams are assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a "small office experience" coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state of the art non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques.  

Employees typically participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see the designs you draw executed in the field, and you'll take on greater responsibility and client exposure as soon as you are ready.  

Frequent lunchtime seminars by industry experts, including our own in-house personnel, keep us current on developments in the profession (with the additional benefit of a free lunch).  

SUPERSTRUCTURES offers top-level compensation for top-level people, and the advancement potential of a thriving company.  

We are committed to a work / life balance, and to a work week of 40 hours.  When, on occasion, more than 40 hours are required, our employees are compensated for every additional hour worked. 
Our benefits include paid holidays, vacation and sick days, health insurance for employee and family, 401(k) with automatic employer contribution, a continuing education allowance, and free NYC Transit MetroCards.  

Our light-filled office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and drop dead views in three directions - not a bad place to spend the workday. 

Our Tribeca location is one of New York City's most convenient and vibrant, easily accessible via public transportation. The A, C, and E subway lines stop right in the building. The N, R, #1, and #6 lines are each just a few blocks away. 

SUPERSTRUCTURES welcomes applications in reply to this posting. Please include a cover letter with salary requirements, your resume, and a few pages of attachments that display your capabilities (maximum of 10MB please).  

Note: Our thanks in advance to those submitting applications; only those candidates under consideration will be contacted.   

For additional information, visit our website at

Title: Junior Project Manager for Commercial Waterproofing Subcontractor
Description:
We are a premier supplier and installer of commercial grade waterproofing solutions of all types throughout the New York City metropolitan area. We are a rapidly expanding business with the goal of being the #1 waterproofing supplier and installer in the tri-state region, for our focus on impeccable quality and outstanding customer delivery. We are building a Project Management division within our company to interface between our Sales, Operations, and Billing teams, and manage clients, installation schedules, and general project coordination as we grow our company. This is an excellent opportunity for a recent graduate to be a formative component of a subcontractor startup, with a daily fast pace, the ability to dip hands into lots of different elements of the business, and exciting, challenging work.
 
•	The Junior Project Manager will report directly to the company Project Manager and will be responsible for managing and handlings all elements of three construction projects simultaneously.
•	The JPM position is 90% in field and 10% in office. The JPM may rotate between all three job sites in a single day, which may be up to an hour apart. The JPM will operate mostly independently, but will be responsible at all times for correspondence related to projects.
•	The JPM will start every morning on the most important of the three job sites, at 7:00am sharp. Work hours are approximately 7:00am until 3-4pm.
•	The JPM visits each job site every day there is work or preparation, or meetings and inspections of work, or to close out a project.
•	On each job site, the JPM will ensure that work is being installed by our team according to plan, that the General Contractor is preparing adequately for the subsequent installation, and that previously installed work has not been damaged or destroyed by other trades.
•	The JPM will meet with the client to understand and coordinate construction and waterproofing installation schedules, and will manage relationships and concerns with the client, owner's representatives, site supervisors, and project managers.
•	Coordinate with the our Project Manager to schedule new work, including tabulating square footages, next scope, finding and checking drawing sets for applicable details, and making the company aware of any change orders during an installation or throughout the progress of the project.
•	JPM will also retain information to give directives to our operations teams on the project sites.
•	Finally, the JPM will monitor installation quality control including meetings with inspectors, will respond with comments and photos to inspection reports, will keep track of supplies used in the installation and their whereabouts, and keep tabs on workflow on site, including ways to optimize the installation process.
 
The Ideal Candidate is a:
•	College graduate with a Bachelors or Masters Degree. Ideal experience will be in the Architecture, Engineering, and Construction trades.
•	Master of multi-managing tasks simultaneously.
•	Knows how to read, understand, and comment on drawings. Knows how to read construction industry specifications.
•	Knows how to convey information on change orders and compare changes in scope.
•	Has existing field experience in the construction industry. We are looking for someone who is able to be hands on when necessary, and professional when necessary, but most of all responsible.
•	Excellent critical thinking and communication skills. To be able to come up with solutions to complex problems on the spot, quickly, and to be a self-starter is essential to this role.
•	Experience with Trello, Telegram, Opsty, Discord, Slack, and Blubeam Revu are plusses but not required.
•	Speaks Spanish or has learned 5+ years of Spanish.
•	A vehicle is highly recommended but not necessary.

Title: Revit Drafter for High-End Glass Wall Company
Description:
Hi! Thanks for your interest, please check out the details below, and if it seems like the right position for you, please reach out with any questions:

JOB DESCRIPTION 
Wing Partners is looking for an architectural Revit drafter to join our company. Currently we do all of our shop drawings in 2D with AutoCAD, and we need someone to help us translate those to Revit. You'll be working alongside experienced project managers who manage multi-million dollar projects, building workplaces for fortune 500 companies. We specialize in glass wall systems for office interiors. (Check out our website for photos www.wingpartners.com). Please note that this is not a design role, but your Revit experience should specifically be in architecture or interior design. 

You will be consulting with our project managers on the details of each project's design, to convert AutoCAD drawings to Revit. You'll also be consulting with the factory to ensure that our Revit process is correct and that the results can be inserted into their production system.

RESPONSIBILITIES 
* Review construction documents
* Develop shop drawings in Revit based on 2D AutoCAD drawings, including plans, elevations, sections, and details
* Assist project managers with change orders, as-built drawings, and other related project tasks
* There may be an opportunity to assist with a broader scope of project management if that appeals to you

REQUIREMENTS
* Proficiency in both Revit and AutoCAD
* Be able to read and understand construction documents
* Strong communication skills in English
* Self-driven, detail oriented, well organized. 
* Located in the NYC metro area

**It's definitely not a requirement, but in an ideal world, we are looking for a candidate who can speak Italian, since our factory is based in Italy. The Revit families for our wall system have been developed in Italy, so this will make communication much easier during the learning period.**

COMPENSATION & TIME 
40 hours per week, with a salary paid bi-weekly. Office hours are 9am-6pm. Health benefits are available after a waiting period of 60 days. Salary will be depending on experience, approximately $45000/year to start.

ABOUT US
Wing Partners is a full-service distributor of modern, high-end customized glass wall systems. We work closely with architects and interior designers to help them achieve their visions for the workplaces of clients such as IBM, Under Armour, AMC, Heineken, Coach, Nike, and many more. At Wing Partners, we're a small tight-knit group who works hard and likes to have fun. Our showroom is in Chelsea, New York City.

CONTACT
Check out our website at WingPartners.com. To apply, please email Joe with your resume/cv, a cover letter, and some Revit work samples using the craigslist link. Thanks!

Title: Energy Engineer
Career Opportunities in Engineering for Immigrant Professionals
Description:
Career Opportunities in Engineering for Immigrant Professionals 

The Cooper Union Retraining Program for Immigrant Engineers at CAMBA assists highly skilled immigrant professionals who are underemployed or unemployed gain access to higher paying jobs through training and job placement assistance. The program includes courses in information technology and mechanical, electrical and civil engineering. Courses are scheduled around the needs of working professionals and offered evenings and weekends. 
Since its inception in 1987, the Retraining Program helped connect more than 4,000 immigrant professionals to science, technology and engineering jobs. 

ALL SERVICES ARE FREE

Classes include:
Green Building Guidelines & Environmental Safety
Building Operation, Maintenance & Safety Regulation
Heating, Ventilation, Air-Condition and Safety Regulation (HVAC)
National Electrical Code (NEC) and Its Applications
AISC Structural Steel Design
ACI Structural Concrete Design
OSHA 30
Introduction to AutoCAD for Engineers
Advanced AutoCAD and Revit
Building Cost Estimating and Bridge, Highway, Railroad Engineering

To be considered for the program applicants must:

• Be born outside of the United States
• Be authorized to work in the United States
• Have a bachelor's degree or higher and professional experience in the field of engineering, information technology, or a related field from the country of origin
• Have lived in the U.S. less than five full years. (Exceptions for those in the U.S. more than five years may be made on a case-by-case basis)
• Be unemployed, underemployed, or working in a field not related to your education
• Have intermediate+ English fluency
• Demonstrate a financial need
• Be highly motivated to pursue professional job search

Please, see our web site www.cooper.edu/immigrant-retraining  for more information and application instructions.
Compensation: This is a free training program with job placement assistance

Title: Revit Drafter needed at High-End Glass Wall Company
Description:
Hi! Thanks for your interest, please check out the details below, and if it seems like the right position for you, please reach out with any questions:

JOB DESCRIPTION 
Wing Partners is looking for an architectural Revit drafter to join our company. Currently we do all of our shop drawings in 2D with AutoCAD, and we need someone to help us translate those to Revit. You'll be working alongside experienced project managers who manage multi-million dollar projects, building workplaces for fortune 500 companies. We specialize in glass wall systems for office interiors. (Check out our website for photos www.wingpartners.com). Please note that this is not a design role, but your Revit experience should specifically be in architecture or interior design. 

You will be consulting with our project managers on the details of each project's design, to convert AutoCAD drawings to Revit. You'll also be consulting with the factory to ensure that our Revit process is correct and that the results can be inserted into their production system.

RESPONSIBILITIES 
* Review construction documents
* Develop shop drawings in Revit based on 2D AutoCAD drawings, including plans, elevations, sections, and details
* Assist project managers with change orders, as-built drawings, and other related project tasks
* There may be an opportunity to assist with a broader scope of project management if that appeals to you
   
REQUIREMENTS
* Proficiency in both Revit and AutoCAD
* Be able to read and understand construction documents
* Strong communication skills in English
* Self-driven, detail oriented, well organized.  
* Located in the NYC metro area

**It's definitely not a requirement, but in an ideal world, we are looking for a candidate who can speak Italian, since our factory is based in Italy. The Revit families for our wall system have been developed in Italy, so this will make communication much easier during the learning period.**
 
COMPENSATION & TIME 
40 hours per week, with a salary paid bi-weekly. Office hours are 9am-6pm. Health benefits are available after a waiting period of 60 days. Salary will be depending on experience, approximately $45000/year to start.

ABOUT US
Wing Partners is a full-service distributor of modern, high-end customized glass wall systems. We work closely with architects and interior designers to help them achieve their visions for the workplaces of clients such as IBM, Under Armour, AMC, Heineken, Coach, Nike, and many more. At Wing Partners, we're a small tight-knit group who works hard and likes to have fun. Our showroom is in Chelsea, New York City.

CONTACT
Check out our website at WingPartners.com. To apply, please email Joe with your resume/cv, a cover letter, and some Revit work samples using the craigslist link. Thanks!

Title: Facade / Building Envelope Project Architect or Engineer
Description:
New York City's leading professional firm dedicated to the preservation of buildings and infrastructure is currently seeking a project architect or engineer with 5 to 10 years of restoration experience.  

SUPERSTRUCTURES works on an array of challenging projects on many of New York's most prominent buildings. We've won frequent awards, as well as the loyalty of some of the premier clients in the region -- public, corporate and residential.  Our work embraces all components of the building envelope and underlying structure - facades, roofs, windows, and plazas - and the full complement of materials, from landmark terra cotta to high performance curtain walls. We take pride in being an industry leader in such practice areas as Local Law 11 inspections and repairs. 

We work in teams. Teams are assigned to projects based on synergies between project requirements and the capabilities of each team member. This arrangement offers employees the dual advantages of a "small office experience" coupled with access to the centralized resources of a larger firm. You'll be supported by some of the most sophisticated technology in the profession, including proprietary computer systems and applications, advanced photography and image processing, and state of the art non-destructive diagnostic equipment and techniques.  

Employees typically participate in all phases of a project from inception through completion: proposal, investigation, construction documents, bid negotiation, and construction administration. You'll have the opportunity to see the designs you draw executed in the field, and you'll take on greater responsibility and client exposure as soon as you are ready.  

Frequent lunchtime seminars by industry experts, including our own in-house personnel, keep us current on developments in the profession (with the additional benefit of a free lunch).  

SUPERSTRUCTURES offers top-level compensation for top-level people, and the advancement potential of a thriving company.  

We are committed to a work / life balance, and to a work week of 40 hours.  When, on occasion, more than 40 hours are required, our employees are compensated for every additional hour worked. 
Our benefits include paid holidays, vacation and sick days, health insurance for employee and family, 401(k) with automatic employer contribution, a continuing education allowance, and free NYC Transit MetroCards.  

Our light-filled office is in a landmarked building with 16' high ceilings, 8' tall windows, and drop dead views in three directions - not a bad place to spend the workday. 

Our Tribeca location is one of New York City's most convenient and vibrant, easily accessible via public transportation. The A, C, and E subway lines stop right in the building. The N, R, #1, and #6 lines are each just a few blocks away. 

SUPERSTRUCTURES welcomes applications in reply to this posting. Please include a cover letter with salary requirements, your resume, and a few pages of attachments that display your capabilities (maximum of 10MB please).  

Note: Our thanks in advance to those submitting applications; only those candidates under consideration will be contacted.   

For additional information, visit our website at

EEA Culture

EEA is a mid-size firm with enough capability, experience and resource to take on the largest of development projects. At the same time, our company is organized in smaller studios which provide for numerous client and employee benefits. As an example of an outward benefit, our studio model ensures that repeat clients interact with consistent managerial and engineering staff that is familiar with client operational models, expectations, norms, etc. Inwardly, studios and the smaller project teams within them, allow our employees to form tight-knit and collegial professional relationships, allow for seamless work sharing and more.

Professional Development - Your Growth is Shared Growth

Title: Construction Inspector - Electrical and Communications Systems
Description:
Seeking experienced Electrical / Communications Systems Construction Inspector for immediate employment based in White Plains.

This inspector will be responsible for field supervision of activities to ensure that the electrical / communications systems construction is performed in accordance with client specifications, contracts, work plans, safety plans and other relevant documents; fulfills quality criteria; and is completed on schedule. This will include reading construction drawings and a working knowledge of local codes and regulations.

Responsibilities and Duties

The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:
•    Inspect work performed by general contractor and subcontractors to verify that work is performed in accordance with
contract plans and specifications, approved shop drawings and approved work plans
•    Review contract documents, including drawings, specification and contracts, and provide technical assistance and
make recommendations for action
•    Prepare written and electronic daily field reports and maintain quality assurance logs detailing work performed, any
deviation from plans, unforeseen conditions, and any non-conforming work
•    Review and monitor schedule, including recommendations for changes.
•    Prepare change order packages.
•    Maintain time and material records for changes as necessary

•    Report any non-compliant conditions to the contractor management and construction manager.
•    Coordinate with any required special testing agencies

Qualifications and Skills

•    Minimum of high school diploma or equivalent.
•    Bachelors of Science in engineering, construction management, or architecture, or equivalent experience preferred.
•    Experience in construction quality assurance and inspection.
•    Strong skills in Microsoft Word and Microsoft Excel.
•    Good communication skills (oral and written) with ability to deal well with clients and employees at all levels.
